fact: A goldfish's attention span is three seconds.
Animals that lay eggs don't have belly buttons.
Beavers can hold their breath for 45 minutes.
Slugs have 4 noses.
A camel has 3 eyelids.
A honey bee can fly at 15 miles per hour.
A queen bee can lay 800–1500 eggs per day.
A bee has 5 eyes.
The average speed of a housefly is 4.5 miles an hour.
Mosquitoes are attracted to people who have recently eaten bananas.
Flamingos turn pink from eating shrimp.
Emus and kangaroos cannot walk backwards.
Cats have over one hundred vocal sounds.
Camel's milk does not curdle.
All porcupines float in water.
The world's termites outweigh the world's humans 10 to 1.
A hummingbird weighs less than a penny.
A jellyfish is 95% water.
Children grow faster in the spring.
Broccoli is the only vegetable that is a flower.
Almonds are members of the peach family.
Alaska has the highest percentage of people that walk to work.
The San Francisco cable cars are the only mobile National Monuments.
The State of Maine has 62 lighthouses.
The only food that doesn't spoil is honey.
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 12 letters.
A ball of glass will bounce higher than a ball of rubber.
Chewing gum while peeling onions will keep you from crying.
On average, a human being will spend 2 weeks kissing in his/her lifetime.
Fish have eyelids.
The average human eats 8 spiders in his/her lifetime while sleeping.
There are 1 million ants for every person in the world.
Termites eat through wood 2 times faster when listening to rock music.
If you keep a goldfish in a dark room, it will eventually turn white.
Elephants sleep only 2 hours a day.
A duck's quack doesn't echo.
A snail breathes through its foot.
Fish cough.
An ant's sense of smell is stronger than a dog's.
It is possible to lead a cow up stairs but not down stairs.
Shrimp can only swim backward.
Frogs can't swallow with their eyes open.
A cat's lower jaw cannot move sideways.
The bullfrog is the only animal that never sleeps.
Elephants are capable of swimming 20 miles a day.
Elephants are the only mammals that can't jump.
Giraffes have no vocal chords.
Cats can hear ultrasound.
Despite its hump, a camel has a straight spine.
Mosquitoes have 47 teeth.
A mile equals 63,360 inches.
Roughly 11% of people are left‑handed.
Over a lifetime, the average woman may ingest about six pounds of lipstick.
An “average smell” has been estimated to weigh about 760 nanograms.
A human brain weighs around three pounds.
About a quarter of your bones are in your feet.
You blink more than ten million times per year.
A sneeze can blast out of your mouth at over 100 mph.
In experiments, brain waves have been used to run an electric train.
Your tongue heals faster than most other body parts.
Pigs can get sunburned.
A taste bud lasts about ten days.
Over a lifetime, you produce roughly 10,000 gallons of saliva.
Strawberries have more vitamin C than oranges.
A one‑day weather forecast can involve about ten billion calculations.
Americans collectively eat about 18 acres of pizza every day.
Animal crackers come in 18 different animal shapes.
“Screeched” is often cited as the longest one‑syllable English word.
No perfect rhyme exists for the English word “month.”
A jiffy is a real unit of time equal to 1/100 of a second.
There’s a town in West Virginia called Big Ugly.
An average person uses about 150 gallons of water daily for personal needs.
You’ll spend roughly two weeks of your life waiting for traffic lights.
At least nine million other people share your birthday.
The average person makes around 1,140 phone calls each year.
Over a lifetime, the average person spends about two years on the phone.
It’s said you can’t fold a sheet of paper in half more than seven times.
Alaska is both the easternmost and westernmost U.S. state.
A U.S. quarter has 119 ridges on its edge.
About 18% of pet owners let their pets share the bed.
Alaska has more caribou than people.
August sees the highest percentage of births.
A googol is 10^100 (a 1 followed by 100 zeros).
Oysters can switch sexes—and switch back again.
The Mona Lisa famously lacks eyebrows.
In 19th‑century Siberia, tea bricks were used as money.
A nautical mile and a land mile aren’t the same distance.
A “ten‑gallon” hat holds less than one gallon.
The average American is said to walk about 18,000 steps per day.
A raindrop falls at roughly seven miles per hour.
Washington, D.C., has more telephones than people.
Fish can drown.
A kangaroo can leap about 30 feet.
Some lizards “do push‑ups” as a form of communication.
Certain squids have eyes as large as a volleyball.
An average American will eat about 35,000 cookies over a lifetime.
A turkey can run at around 20 miles per hour.
You weigh a bit less when the moon is directly overhead.
Chewing gum burns roughly 20 calories per hour.
Each year, you walk about four miles just making your bed.
On any given day, about half of Americans are on a diet.
A one‑minute kiss can burn about 26 calories.
Frowning uses more calories than smiling.
There are more than 30,000 documented diets.
Walking on hard dirt burns about 7% more calories than on pavement.
You weigh slightly less on a mountaintop than at sea level.
Sleeping burns more calories than watching TV.
Licking a postage stamp uses roughly 10 calories.
Smelling bananas or apples may help curb appetite.
Frogs don’t drink water; they absorb it through their skin.
Only male turkeys gobble.
Dalmatian puppies are born all white.
A racehorse has been clocked at over 43 mph.
A tortoise once reported as the oldest known animal lived to 152 years.
Bamboo makes up around 99% of a panda’s diet.
The whale shark is the largest fish, exceeding 50 feet and around 2 tons.
A starfish can turn its stomach inside out.
Honeybees are the only insects that make a food humans eat (honey).
Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backward.
Antarctica is the only continent without native reptiles or snakes.
Penguins are birds that swim but cannot fly.
Ducks bob their heads as they walk.
Prehistoric beavers were once as big as bears.
Seals sleep in very short bursts—about 90 seconds at a time.
The U.S. Coast Guard trained pigeons to spot people lost at sea.
A pigeon’s feathers outweigh its bones.
A hummingbird’s heart can beat about 1,400 times per minute.
Dragonflies have six legs yet aren’t able to walk.
Mosquitoes are said to have 47 “teeth.”
Koalas and humans both have unique fingerprints.
Penguins have a gland above their eyes that helps desalinate seawater.
Crocodiles can’t move their tongues.
Honeybees navigate using the sun as a compass.
An ant can lift about 50 times its own weight.
One coffee tree yields roughly a pound of beans per year.
Strawberries are the only fruits with seeds on the outside.
Los Angeles reportedly has about three times more cars than people.
Hawaii is the only U.S. state that grows coffee.
Hawaii is the only state with a single, statewide school district.
Holland (the Netherlands) is cited as the only country with an official national dog.
Washington State’s official dance is the square dance.
Hawaii is the only U.S. state never to record 0°F or colder.
No U.S. state name contains the letter “Q.”
Texas permits absentee ballots to be cast from space.
Lake Superior is listed as the world’s largest lake.
The smallest U.S. county by area is New York County—Manhattan.
In Panama, you can see the sun rise over the Pacific and set over the Atlantic.
The tallest recorded man measured 8 feet 11 inches.
President Theodore Roosevelt was blind in one eye.
The first sport captured on film was boxing (1894).
In 1963, the fastest tennis serve was clocked at 154 mph.
By 1985, a bicyclist had been clocked at 154 mph.
New York City’s speed limit in 1895 was 8 mph.
Americans spend over $630 million per year on golf balls.
The first outdoor mini‑golf courses (1926) were built on New York rooftops.
U.S. swimming pools together hold enough water to cover San Francisco.
TV’s first soap opera debuted in 1946.
MTV launched with “Video Killed the Radio Star.”
The first TV show rerun was “The Lone Ranger.”
An early working title for “Friends” was “Insomnia Café.”
The first U.S. network children’s show was “Captain Kangaroo.”
The Sun’s interior reaches about 15 million degrees Fahrenheit.
The very first penny carried the motto “Mind your own business.”
The earliest vacuum cleaner was so big it had to be hauled by horses.
Your pupils can dilate up to roughly 45% when you see something you like.
Before mercury, thermometers used brandy.
You’d need to play ping‑pong for about 12 hours to lose a pound.
About 200,000 frowns can etch a single brow wrinkle.
The first human‑made sonic boom came from a cracking whip.
The first phone book (1878) listed only 50 names.
The most sensitive body areas are the mouth and fingertips.
Your eyes make about 50 tiny movements each second.
Chinese is the most spoken language in the world.
The largest pyramid on Earth is in Mexico, not Egypt.
In 1634, tulip bulbs served as currency in Holland.
The earliest bicycles were called hobbyhorses.
The first sailing boats were built in ancient Egypt.
Ballpoint pens first went on sale in 1945 for $12.
The Statue of Liberty became the first lighthouse to use electricity in 1886.
The first VCR, made in 1956, was about the size of a piano.
The first jukebox appeared in San Francisco in 1899.
Rainbows are only visible in the morning or late afternoon.
The U.S. Capitol has 365 steps—one for each day of the year.
The most common English letters are E, T, A, O, I, and N.
An adult male kangaroo is called a boomer.
An adult female kangaroo is called a flyer.
The U.S. has over 61,000 pizzerias.
Antarctica is the driest, coldest, windiest, and highest continent.
The Sahara Desert spans a greater distance than California to New York.
Thailand’s name translates to “Land of the Free.”
Popcorn was invented by Indigenous peoples of the Americas.
Jupiter spins so quickly that it gets a new sunrise about every 10 hours.
The year 1961 looks the same upside down; the next such year will be 6009.
You don’t need to be a lawyer to serve on the U.S. Supreme Court.
Eleven U.S. states are named after people.
Doubling a penny daily for 30 days grows to $5,368,709.12.
In 1859, the first tightrope crossing of Niagara Falls took place.
The United States is the largest country named for a real person.
The largest cheesecake ever made weighed 57,508 pounds.
Austria was the first country to issue postcards.
